channel.title: The forvision package for R on the Forvision project
channel.description: Recent content in The forvision package for R on the Forvision project

item.title: How to download and install
item.description: Installation You can install the development version of the forvision package (containing the latest improvements and bug fixes) from github: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("forvis/forvision")

item.title: Loading data
item.description: Load data from URLs (from example datasets) 1) Load time series data: data_ts <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/forvis/forvision_data/master/example1_TSTS.csv") head(data_ts) series_id value timestamp 1 Y1 3103.96 1984 2 Y1 3360.27 1985 3 Y1 3807.63 1986 4 Y1 4387.88 1987 5 Y1 4936.99 1988 6 Y1 5379.75 1989 2) Load forecast data: data_fc <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/forvis/forvision_data/master/example1_FTS.csv") head(data_fc) series_id method timestamp origin_timestamp forecast horizon lo90 hi90 1 Y1 A 1989 1988 5406.43 1 5183.349 5629.511 2 Y1 A 1990 1988 5875.

item.title: Problems and Issues
item.description: Problems and Issues Please report any issues you may encounter in our issues page on github
